description:
Contract Land Staff is looking for a Director of Pipelines on behalf of Paragon, a CLS Company. The Director plays a pivotal role in overseeing a spectrum of right-of-way related work essential for supporting energy sector projects while spearheading the expansion of our presence within the oil and gas sector and the rapidly expanding clean energy sector. This role encompasses a progression from administrative and foundational support tasks to orchestrating intricate, politically nuanced, cross-disciplinary transactions and project management duties, with a keen focus on managing scope, budgets, and timelines. In addition to preparing comprehensive scope details, cost estimates, budgets, schedules, and project deliverables, the Director assumes responsibility for cultivating the growth of our energy portfolio. They undertake nuanced tasks demanding specialized expertise, while also orchestrating project teams and subconsultants effectively. Mentoring and training project teams, the Director ensures alignment with project specifics, client requirements, and regulatory frameworks. A deep understanding of title reports, vesting types, lending instruments, agreements, negotiation strategies, and appraisal standards is essential. Moreover, the ideal candidate will bring a track record in marketing and business development. With a commitment to fostering positive client relationships, the Director serves as a cornerstone in nurturing both existing and prospective clientele.

Essential Functions:
• Represent the company in a professional and competent manner with the client.
• Represent the client with governments and agencies on all levels (federal, state, and local).
• Negotiate agreements on behalf of client with governments, agencies, districts, other energy companies and private parties.
• Interface with client’s engineering staff or consultants to gather all relevant information, documents, plans, and designs to aid in securing required government approvals, permits, and franchise agreements.
• Providing oversight and assistance to project managers in their role leading project teams, developing scopes, budgets and cost estimates for projects.
• Responsible for providing oversight and reviewing title and due diligence reports produced by project staff.
• Responsible for delivering development projects of varying size and complexity.
• Responsible for managing and executing all project activities.
• Review and understand project/property/owner/tenant specific information; project maps, engineering designs, title reports, vesting deeds, property profiles, appraisals, estimates, budgets, and schedules.
• As applicable, present offers, negotiate and justify proposed settlements for clients/files.
• Effectively and accurately communicate relevant project information, objective and goals, to the project team.
• Provide QA/QC on all project components.
• Review project team timesheets for accuracy and compliance with scope of work and contract constraints.
• Communicate with project managers regarding scope changes, potential over-run of budget, schedule constraints or other project/contract specific issues.
• Identify and prospect for new project opportunities by contacting current and potential clients.
• Network and meet with prospective clients to develop opportunities for new business.
• Present new products and services to enhance existing relationships with clients.
• Ensure that all reports, databases, file information and diaries are updated and maintained accurately and in a timely fashion by project staff.
• Coordinate meetings with clients, property owners, tenants, subconsultants and other stakeholders as needed.
• Coordinate project agreements, contracts, receivables, subconsultant deliverables, etc.
• Review and understand a variety of project maps, exhibit maps, legal descriptions and designs (e.g. engineering, plan & profile, cross section, stripmaps, utility, plot plans, subdivision maps, record of surveys, etc.).
• Knowledgeable with acquisition documents, notices, processes and procedures.
• Demonstrates a high level of knowledge of real estate practices and principles, including encroachments, prescriptive, mineral, water & aerial rights.

Desired Education and Qualifications:
• Valid driver’s license with clean driving record and proof of current auto insurance policy.
• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent or relevant experience.
• A minimum of ten (10) years of progressive right of way industry experience, with at least five (5) years of right of way experience in the pipeline field.
• At least 5 years of Project Management experience in the right-of-way industry overseeing right-of-way projects, preferably in the Pipeline industry.
• At least 5 years of supervisory experience overseeing and directing teams of 5 or more employees.
• Experience working in the consulting industry is highly desirable.
• Proven track record of successful business development within the energy sector, with a demonstrated ability to identify, nurture, and capitalize on growth opportunities in the Energy sector.
• Sr Right of Way Agent (SRWA) designation from the IRWA, desirable.
• Must be computer savvy with high level of proficiency in Microsoft products including Word, Excel, Outlook, Teams and basic database management systems.
• Must have strong oral and written communication skills, and be customer focused.
• Possess excellent interpersonal skills to build relationships with others.
• Must be able provide clear direction to project team, communicate clients’ business needs, and interface effectively and/or collaborate with others.
• Able to accurately analyze information and provide advice, solutions and recommendations on decisions.
• Must take initiative and accountability for the accuracy of information and for achieving results.
• Possess a high level of experience planning and organizing workload, adjusting to changing priorities, and working well under pressure with minimal supervision.
• Must be self-reliant, capable of working in the office, field and on assignment.
• High level of experience and understanding in various types of right of way projects.
